goals.question: What is the distribution of population across different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of population vs country
goals.rationale: This visualization helps in understanding the population distribution across different countries and identifying the countries with the highest and lowest population.

goals.question: What is the relationship between GDP per capita and life expectancy?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of GDP per capita vs life expectancy
goals.rationale: This visualization helps in identifying the correlation between GDP per capita and life expectancy, and whether countries with higher GDP per capita have higher life expectancy.

goals.question: What is the distribution of land area across different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of land area vs country
goals.rationale: This visualization helps in understanding the land area distribution across different countries and identifying the countries with the largest and smallest land area.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population density across different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of population density vs country
goals.rationale: This visualization helps in understanding the population density distribution across different countries and identifying the countries with the highest and lowest population density.

goals.question: What is the relationship between literacy rate and GDP per capita?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of literacy rate vs GDP per capita
goals.rationale: This visualization helps in identifying the correlation between literacy rate and GDP per capita, and whether countries with higher literacy rate have higher GDP per capita.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='population', ascending=False)
    plt.figure(figsize=(15, 6))
    plt.bar(data['country'], data['population'])
    plt.xlabel('Country')
    plt.ylabel('Population')
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population across different countries?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    scatter = ax.scatter(data['GDP per capita'], data['life expectancy'], c=data['GDP per capita'], cmap='viridis')
    plt.xlabel('GDP per capita')
    plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between GDP per capita and life expectancy?', wrap=True)
    legend1 = ax.legend(*scatter.legend_elements(), title="GDP per capita")
    ax.add_artist(legend1)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='land_area', ascending=False)
    plt.figure(figsize=(15, 6))
    plt.bar(data['country'], data['land_area'], color='c')
    plt.xlabel('Country')
    plt.ylabel('Land Area')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of land area across different countries?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.legend(['Land Area'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='population_density', ascending=False)
    plt.figure(figsize=(15, 6))
    plt.bar(data['country'], data['population_density'], color='c')
    plt.xlabel('Country')
    plt.ylabel('Population Density')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population density across different countries?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.legend(['Population Density'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['literacy_rate'], data['GDP_per_capita'])
    plt.xlabel('Literacy Rate')
    plt.ylabel('GDP per Capita')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between literacy rate and GDP per capita?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
